citation.article-title: Maritimimonas rapanae gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from gut microflora of the veined rapa whelk, Rapana venosa
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Maritimimonas rapanae sp. nov.
Maritimimonas rapanae (ra.pa′na.e. N.L. gen. n. rapanae of Rapana, the generic name of the mollusc from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are 0.3–0.4 μm wide and 0.8–1.2 μm long and sometimes show filamentous growth (Supplementary Fig. S2).
Colonies on MA are circular, smooth, convex, yellow-pigmented and glistening with entire margins, do not adhere to the agar and are approximately 2.0 mm in diameter after 7 days at 30 °C (pH 7).
Growth occurs at 10–37 °C (optimum, 30 °C) and pH 5–9 (optimum, pH 7).
Growth occurs in media (ZoBell's, TSA, R2A and NA) containing 3–6 % sea salts (optimum, 4–5 %), but not in media supplemented with NaCl (1–12 %) alone.
Cells grow in the bottom of tubes as viscid sediments.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Gelatin is degraded, but aesculin, DNA, agar, casein, CM-cellulose, crystalline cellulose (filter paper), chitin, starch and Tween 80 are not.

In API ZYM tests, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, leucine arylamidase and valine arylamidase activities are present, cystine arylamidase and trypsin activities are weakly positive and α-glucosidase, lipase (C14), α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase and α-mannosidase activities are absent.
In GN2 MicroPlate (Biolog) tests, d-glucose, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, hydroxy-l-proline, l-ornithine, l-serine and l-threonine are utilized.

Sensitive to (μg per disc, unless indicated) chloramphenicol (30), erythromycin (15), tetracycline (30) and vancomycin (30); resistant to amikacin (30), ampicillin (10), gentamicin (10), kanamycin (30), nalidixic acid (30), penicillin (10 IU), polymyxin B (300 IU) and streptomycin (10).
The predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH and summed feature 3 (comprising iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 31.7 mol%.
The type strain is A31T (=KCTC 22186T =JCM 15075T), isolated from a sample from a veined rapa whelk (Rapana venosa) collected from the South Sea, Republic of Korea.
